Is a description provided of what variables are related to attrition/missing data?
Is a description provided of how missing data in the analyses were dealt with?
Is information about the distribution of the observed variables included?
Is the software mentioned?

Checklist Item: Are the raw data plotted along with the estimates?

Would this involve comparing any models to those with only a single class? CJ: No, but this does relate to the arguments 'variance' and 'covariance'. Basically, users should examine the fit of models that allow variances or even covariances to vary between classes.
Checklist Item: Are alternative specifications of within-class heterogeneity considered (e.g., LGCA vs. LGMM) and clearly documented? If not, was sufficient justification provided as to eliminate certain specifications from consideration?
Are alternative shape/functional forms of the trajectories described?
